bill.title: Pharmacy Practice Act; reenact and extend repealer on and make various changes to.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Automatic Repealer On The Sections That Create The State Board Of Pharmacy And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Reenact Sections 73-21-71 Through 73-21-123, Which Is The "mississippi Pharmacy Practice Act"; To Amend Section 73-21-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Provision That Requires Drug Manufacturers To Allow The Return Of Outdated Drugs From Pharmacies; To Amend Section 73-21-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Appointment And Qualifications Of Members Of The State Board Of Pharmacy; To Amend Sections 73-21-83 And 73-21-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees For Pharmacy Benefit Managers; To Amend Sections 73-21-157 And 73-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Regulatory Authority Of The State Board Of Pharmacy Relating To Pharmacy Benefit Managers; To Amend Section 73-21-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Permitting Requirements For Nonresident Pharmacies That Deliver Prescription Drugs Into This State, And To Require The Pharmacist-in-charge Of A Nonresident Pharmacy To Hold A Mississippi Pharmacist License; To Amend Section 41-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Registration Of Out-of-state Facilities That Distribute Or Dispense Controlled Substances Within The State; To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Pharmacy To Assess A Fee Against Each Person Licensed To Prescribe Controlled Substances In Mississippi For The Purpose Of Funding The Mississippi Prescription Monitoring Program And To Indemnify Those Creating Or Using The Prescription Monitoring Program; To Amend Sections 73-9-43, 73-15-20, 73-19-21, 73-25-14, 73-26-3 And 73-27-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Licensure Fees For Dentists, Nurses, Midwives And Nurse Practitioners, Optometrists, Physicians, Physician Assistants And Podiatrists; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Human Services
